content.description: This ascends up to and through the obvious weakness left of center in the main face.  Start on crimps at mid height and not great feet, then reach up to decent hold behind flake.  From there, go for the topout.
content.protection: Good landing, but you could use a pad.
content.location: Start right of the left arete (Pouty Lips, V0).  Descend the obvious lichen strewn side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start, and traverse the cool lip from the back side (the side roughly facing the Beehive Boulder).

This climbs the curved, fat, left arete of the obvious, back face. Sit start down low on the arete and work your way up the tallest point of the boulder before topping out. Key holds make this pretty easy but really fun at the grade. A great warm up. The crux may be the start.
content.protection: Good landing, but you might use a pad.
content.location: This ascends the left arete.  See the pictures.  Descend pretty easily down licheny rear.

content.description: Start laying back on a huge hold near the right arete.  Work your feet up, grab the lip, traverse a bit, and then go for a surprisingly heroic and fun topout.
content.protection: Decent landing, but you should use a pad.
content.location: This ascends the right arete of main face.  Descend down an obvious ramp.

content.description: Same start as Clove Cigarettes. Dyno to the lip
content.location: New Wave boulder. See Clove Cigarettes

content.description: This starts underneath and to the right of a nice but not huge jug in the center or center/right of the main face. Start on undercling with poor feet and workÂ up to the decent jug, then go for the topout. It may be easier if you are tall.
content.protection: Good landing, but you could use a pad.
content.location: This ascends the center or center/right of the main face.  Start under fairly obvious hold a foot or two beneath the lip.  The descent is obvious.

content.description:
This is a striking boulder that looks like a breaking wave.  The main face (see photo) has several easy problems that are fun for the grade.  The overhanging nature of the main face makes for cool topouts especially at the grade.   

  There may be other problems on a smaller overhanging face to the left of the main face.
